intro: Centaurea hystrix, commonly known as the spiked centaurea, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its striking, spiky purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Centaurea hystrix is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat skin conditions and as a remedy for inflammation.
